required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Efficacy, and Tolerability of Vilazodone in Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Fixed-dose Study of Vilazodone in Patients With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to further characterize the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of a single fixed dose level of vilazodone compared to placebo in patients with major depressive disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at Week 8
primary_outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale for assessing depressive symptomatology that had occurred in participants during the week preceding each interview. Patients were rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and lack of interest. Each item was scored on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score was the sum of the scores on the 10 items and ranged from 0 to 60. A higher score indicated more depressive symptomatology. A negative change score indicated improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Clinical Global Impressions-Severity (CGI-S) Score at Week 8
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI-S is a clinician-rated scale for assessing the severity of the participant's current state of mental illness compared with a patient population with major depressive disorder. The clinician responded to the following question "Considering your total clinical experience with this population, how mentally ill is the participant at this time?" on a 7-point scale: 1=normal, not at all ill; 2=borderline ill; 3=mildly ill; 4=moderately ill; 5=markedly ill; 6=severely ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients. The scale ranges from 1 to 7. A higher score indicates more severe mental illness. A negative change score indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Sustained Response Rate
secondary_outcome.description: The MADRS Sustained response rate is defined as a MÅDRS total score ≤ 12 for at least the last 2 consecutive visits during the double-blind treatment period.

arm_group.description: Participants received dose-matched placebo orally once daily for 9 weeks.

Participants received vilazodone orally once daily for 9 weeks, as follows: Week 1, 10 mg once a day; Week 2, 20 mg once a day; Weeks 3 to 8, 40 mg once a day; and Week 9 (down-taper period), 20 mg once a day for 4 days, then 10 mg once a day for 3 days.

intervention.description: Dose-matched placebo was supplied as tablets.

group.title: Dose-matched Placebo
group.description: Participants received dose-matched placebo orally once daily for 9 weeks.

group.title: Vilazodone
group.description: Participants received vilazodone orally once daily for 9 weeks, as follows: Week 1, 10 mg once a day; Week 2, 20 mg once a day; Weeks 3 to 8, 40 mg once a day; and Week 9 (down-taper period), 20 mg once a day for 4 days, then 10 mg once a day for 3 days.

baseline.population: Safety population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind investigational product.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in the Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at Week 8
outcome.description: The MADRS is a clinician-rated scale for assessing depressive symptomatology that had occurred in participants during the week preceding each interview. Patients were rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and lack of interest. Each item was scored on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score was the sum of the scores on the 10 items and ranged from 0 to 60. A higher score indicated more depressive symptomatology. A negative change score indicated improvement.
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind investigational product and who had a Baseline and at least 1 post-baseline assessment of the MADRS total score.

Patients were rated on 10 items to assess feelings of sadness, lassitude, pessimism, inner tension, suicidality, reduced sleep or appetite, difficulty concentrating, and lack of interest. Each item was scored on a 7-point scale from 0 (no symptoms) to 6 (symptoms of maximum severity). The total score was the sum of the scores on the 10 items and ranged from 0 to 60. outcome.description: The CGI-S is a clinician-rated scale for assessing the severity of the participant’s current state of mental illness compared with a patient population with major depressive disorder. analysis.estimate_desc: The Mean Difference (Final Values), as well as the 95% Confidence Interval, are in units of percentage.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were reported from the time the participant signs the informed consent form until 30 days after the last dose of treatment (up to 13 weeks).
reported_events.desc: Safety population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of double-blind investigational product. The Severe Adverse Event data presented here is for the safety population. The Other Adverse Event data presented here is for the safety population during the 8 week double-blind treatment period.

group.title: Dose-matched Placebo
group.description: Participants received dose-matched placebo orally once daily for 9 weeks.

group.description: Participants received vilazodone orally once daily for 9 weeks, as follows: Week 1, 10 mg once a day; Week 2, 20 mg once a day; Weeks 3 to 8, 40 mg once a day; and Week 9 (down-taper period), 20 mg once a day for 4 days, then 10 mg once a day for 3 days.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All data generated in this study will be the property of Forest Research Institute, Inc. An integrated clinical and statistical report will be prepared at the completion of the study. Publication of the results by the Investigator will be subject to mutual agreement between the Investigator and Forest Research Institute, Inc.
